Legal_Issue: Whether the Visa Officer acted within authority by rejecting the application based on doubts about job responsibilities without seeking clarification
Evidence_Assessment: Visa Officer doubted applicant's job responsibilities based on assumptions about small businesses
Decision_Outcome: Rejection of Ms. Sandhu's visa application
Burden_of_Proof: Applicant must demonstrate experience in skilled occupations as defined by NOC
Credibility_Factor: Doubt raised by Visa Officer regarding authenticity or nature of job responsibilities
Legal_Rule: Applicants must demonstrate experience in skilled occupations (NOC 1241); procedural fairness requires clarification when doubts exist
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide procedural fairness by not seeking clarification from applicant
Grounds_for_Claim: Unverified assumptions about applicantâ€™s job responsibilities
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided; matter remitted for re-determination
Review_Standard: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act, section 18.1
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Violation found: Officer did not seek clarification despite complete application
Key_Evidence_Considered: Employment letters confirming duties aligned with NOC 1241
Legal_Framework: Federal Courts Act, section 18.1; Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged rejection due to lack of procedural fairness
Court_Result: Matter remitted for re-determination by a different visa officer
Outcome: Judicial review granted, remitted for re-determination
Remedy_Sought: Re-determination by a different visa officer
Legal_Provision: Federal Courts Act, s. 18.1; IRPR SOR/2002-227
Legal_Provision_Cited: Federal Courts Act, s. 18.1; Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, SOR/2002-227
